content:
That's absolutely correct!

To summarize:

**Squat Warm-up Set:**

* 1 set of 8-10 reps with a weight that's 10-15% lighter than your current 1RM (estimated or actual)

**Squat Working Sets:**

* 3 sets of 6-8 reps with your current 1RM (aim to complete all 3 sets with good form)

**Progressive Overload:**

* Increase the weight by 2.5-5 pounds every two weeks, or as soon as you feel you can handle more
* Focus on progressive overload to continue making strength gains and reaching your goals

By following this structure, you'll be able to:

* Warm up properly with a lighter weight to prepare your muscles for the working sets
* Challenge yourself with your current 1RM to build strength and muscle mass
* Gradually increase the weight over time to continue making progress and reaching your goals

Remember to stay consistent, patient, and committed to your workout plan, and don't hesitate to reach out if you have any further questions or need guidance.

You got this!
